name: Emerging Markets Momentum Strategy Backtest
question: How would a 6-month momentum strategy have performed on EEM over the last decade?
retailQuestion: Should I follow trends when investing in emerging markets?
description: Backtests a momentum strategy on the iShares MSCI Emerging Markets ETF (EEM) using 6-month rolling returns. Analyzes performance during emerging market crises, currency devaluations, and global risk-on/risk-off cycles over 12 years including major EM events and recoveries.

workflow.description: Step 1: Get 12+ years of EEM daily price data covering EM cycles
Step 2: Get current EEM market data for momentum context
Step 3: Calculate 6-month momentum signals and risk-off indicators
Step 4: Backtest momentum strategy through EM crisis periods
Step 5: Analyze performance during crisis vs normal periods

followUp: Are emerging markets too risky for momentum strategies?
Should I avoid emerging markets during uncertain times?
How much emerging market exposure should I have?
Do momentum signals work the same in all markets?
